events.event_text: You wake up to the sound of an old radio alarm clock. In just 8 days your girlfriend is leaving city x for town y. You know you want to be with this person, but you're not sure you're ready to leave.

possible_choices.display_text: I don't really want to deal with this today, just like dick around online
possible_choices.responce_text: You boot up the old computron and go for a ride on the chrome pony

possible_choices.display_text: Run a couple gigs for the local megacorp
possible_choices.responce_text: Cash has been pretty short lately. You really don't want to but you should probably get out there and make some bread
It's a beautiful day. You should try to enjoy your neighborhood while you still can.
I really don't want to deal with this. Back to sleep I go!

events.event_text: You see a pop up ad. Normaly you would'nt click a pop up, but I'll be damned if those singles near you aren't very cute.

possible_choices.responce_text: "Hotties here I come!" The ad leads to a sketchy site with nary a hot single in sight. Your computer is acting a little slow, but you ignore it and click away.
Disappointing frankly. Fortune favors the bold you silly goose, try new things.

events.event_text: Suddenly your computer stutters and then blue screens. From your computer's internal speaker you hear a modulated voice- "You got your self a real problem cuz."

possible_choices.responce_text: Your computer's been hacked and now this motherfucker is holding it hostage. You have literally no money so your only option is to talk him out of it.

events.event_text: Success! the hacker is so impressed with you that he unlockes your computer free of charge.

possible_choices.responce_text: In the end he settled for a few choice pictures of your feet. Don't look a gift horse in the mouth.

events.event_text: Yeah no he wants cash and this is not a thing that you have. Not even almost.

possible_choices.responce_text: At this rate your night is basically over. You no longer have access to the internet.

events.event_text: You get stuck in a totally pointless flamewar.

possible_choices.display_text: This dumb man is wrong and I *need* him to know it.
possible_choices.responce_text: What a stupid jerk lets do this.

possible_choices.display_text: This is silly just ignore him
possible_choices.responce_text: I'm sorry I literally can't.

events.event_text: You totally made that internet stranger cry.

possible_choices.responce_text: How dare he have a marginally different oppinion than you.

events.event_text: You tried to shout down a digital shitlord but his mind was utterly impenetrable

possible_choices.responce_text: He's totally not even worth it.

events.event_text: You notice an off looking facebook post. It's from your grandmother and wow is it racist. Much more racist than you remember Gram-Gram being. This is the nice grandmother. Something seems off about this...

possible_choices.display_text: You decide to shoot ol' Grams a dm. Some minutes later she sends you an email explaining she can't figure out how to reply to the mail tweet you sent her. Sure whatever.
possible_choices.responce_text: Hey what was up with that thing you posted on FB?

possible_choices.display_text: It's not my job to explain white privilege to dinosaurs. Ignore it.
possible_choices.responce_text: It's confounding how unwilling you are to engage with this game.

events.event_text: After long hours of seemingly futile discourse, you actually manage to reach your oldest relative. She promises she'll read the sources you sited before saying goodnight.

possible_choices.responce_text: I guess that's the best you could hope for.

events.event_text: It's no use. The beloved relative you remember is gone. What remains is angry and nervous and alone. Seemingly bereft of both critical thinking and empathy, your grandmother leaves you feeling scared for your own winter years.

possible_choices.display_text: I thought this game was supposed to be funny.
possible_choices.responce_text: I'm sorry.

events.event_text: After frittering away a lovely day and doom scrolling well into the night you find yourself consumed by a righteous self-loathing.

possible_choices.responce_text: You muster your energies to try and face down the demons you've been using the internet to ignore.

events.event_text: You totally beat your own ass metaphysically speaking.

possible_choices.responce_text: Yeah no, you've become a better well rounded person; and slightly less addicted to the internet.

events.event_text: Try as you might you can't seem to win this argument with yourself. Pathetic really.

possible_choices.responce_text: Better luck next time I guess.

events.event_text: Today is the day you have been dreading. Your partner is expecting you to pack up and leave PsudoYork with her. Today she exepcts an answer. Will you commit to living your life with her, or will you stay in the city you love?

possible_choices.display_text: Try to persuade her to stay here with you
possible_choices.responce_text: You want to spend the rest of your life with this woman, but you know in your heart you'll never be happy where she's going. You have to convince her to stay.

possible_choices.display_text: Bite the bullet and tell her you'll go with her
possible_choices.responce_text: In the end the choice was almost easy. You don't want to leave psudoyork but you are commited to this person. That's all there is to it.

possible_choices.display_text: Tell her to leave without you
possible_choices.responce_text: The last couple days have been a wake up call. You can't spend your life chasing someone elses dreams, It was never your choice to leave and you're not the one going to grad school. Telling her is hard but you have no other choice.

events.event_text: In the end she gives over to the idea completely. "I got accepted to a really interesting program in PsudoYork anyway. I think I just needed to feel like I was taking control of my life. Leaving felt like the way to do that, but now I'm not so sure."

possible_choices.display_text: Is it selfish to bend the destiny oof the person you love?
possible_choices.responce_text: Who can say. For once in your life just take the win.

events.event_text:
Try as you might you just can't persuade her to stay. She's furious that you would play around with this so close to her deadline. 
 "I already signed a lease! How could you do this?!"

possible_choices.display_text: Beg forgiveness and ask if she'll still have you. It's your only option
possible_choices.responce_text: Reluctantly she accepts, but you can tell this did some damage. She may not trust you as much as she did before.

events.event_text: The conversation started tense, but after laying out how you felt, Sam honestly took it really well. People respect honesty and this people cares about you a lot.

possible_choices.responce_text: You're relationship with Sam ends on a bittersweet note, but after an appropriate amount of time (6 months) you settle into a strong long-distance friendship. Change is good and you flourish.

events.event_text: This conversation does not go well and you both end up in bitter tears. For some time after you try to persuade yourself that you are better off without the person you were once closest to, but this attitude has unforseen consequences.

possible_choices.responce_text: You spend a couple years confounded and hurt. When you eventually recover from what you would later consider a spiritual downturn, you are a different creature entirely. Change is good.
